Key Match Events: Bobby Witt Jr. hit a tiebreaking single in a four-run eighth inning.
Kansas City Royals beat Minnesota Twins 4-2.
Royals rallied against Jhoan Durán and Griffin Jax.
Kyle Isbel hit an RBI single.
Tommy Pham reached on an infield hit and Dairon Blanco scored on the error.
MJ Melendez drove in Pham with a two-out single.
Daniel Lynch allowed one hit in three scoreless innings.
Lucas Erceg pitched a perfect ninth for his 10th save.
Post-Match Reflections: Bobby Witt Jr. expressed his excitement about being in key moments.
Kansas City manager Matt Quatraro praised the quality of at-bats against Duran.
Twins manager Rocco Baldelli expressed frustration over not winning with a two-run lead in the eighth inning.
Quatraro highlighted Daniel Lynch's efficient performance.
Baldelli praised Bailey Ober's impeccable pitching.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Royals right-hander Dan Altavilla cleared waivers and was assigned outright to Triple-A Omaha.
Twins 1B Carlos Santana left in the bottom of the sixth inning with an unspecified illness.
